definition: mutual attraction (e.g. electrostatic)/to attract one another
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
opposite polarities attract/(fig.) opposite sexes attract/opposites attract

sentences.english: The adage 'opposites attract', holds true when you think of Virgo and Pisces compatibility.
sentences.chinese: “異性相吸”很好的形容了處女座和雙魚座間的關係。

sentences.english: I guess it was a case of opposites attracting.
sentences.chinese: 我猜可能是異性相吸吧。

sentences.english: I guess it's true that "opposites attract"!
Like charges repel, but opposite charges attract, which is one of the fundamental laws of electricity.
sentences.chinese: 電荷同性相斥，異性相吸，這是電的一個基本規律。

sentences.english: Like hydrogen and oxygen, for some couples, opposites attract.
sentences.chinese: 就像氫和氧，有些人成雙成對的緣故是因爲異性相吸。

sentences.english: When it comes to love, we're ambivalent about "opposites attract".
sentences.chinese: 說到愛情，我們對異性相吸懷有矛盾的看法。
這就是異性相吸的原因所在。

definition: mutual repulsion (e.g. electrostatic)/to repel one another
opposite polarities attract/(fig.) opposite sexes attract/opposites attract
like polarities repel each other/(fig.) like repels like
soul brothers/friends in spirit who have never met/to commune with
two hearts beat as one (idiom); a kindred spirit
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
